div.p: Back from Geneva, where we had a very good time with the Foggs, who have a nice suburban house, garden and poodle puppy. And car. They took us to see the snow; and to see an estriptiz show, where 35 girls went through the same formula about as mechanically as most bullfighters fight their bulls....We brought back lost lots of food and warm clothes and pots and pans for the AGA; no trouble with the customs, because they had never seen a hula-hula hoop before and Diana showed them how. Have We have built a coke shed, and I have at last a fire which doesn't smoke in my work room. Still very warm here.
Will go and raise stink about your gloves: yes, sir! My leather jacket is splendid.

Of course, the installing of oneself is expensive; so let us know how the monthly budget works out when you have all that is needed.. & I'll not let you down...Meanwhile, you have enough solvency I hope. If not, let me know how much and I'll send.
No news about Claudius of late, but the Broadway musical seems a serious proposition & Bill Watt is finding out more about it for me. Still 4 books of Iliad to complete.
Juan getting high marks in science: odd. But I'm glad he has something he likes.
So sorry not to have written for so long - sent you some cheese from Geneva which I hope will keep you going until I find a sobrasada-bearer. love, Mother
Have you seen the French magazine called SONORAMA which is made of records - comes out at 500fr for a month. Rather like a newsreel.
Yes, by all means get the anti-polio injections offered you. Lucia and Juan are having them too. But you must be in good health at the time!
